title: Statistical Inferences
description: How do we make inferences that are "statsitically sound"?
contents: A statistic is a function of sample data. The sum, average, variance or standard deviation of the sample data are examples of a statistic. Since a statistic is itself a function of sample from a random process, it will exhibit randomness.

title: Statistical Inferences
description: How do we make inferences that are "statsitically sound"?
contents: A statistic is a function of sample data. The sum, average, variance or standard deviation of the sample data are examples of a statistic. Since a statistic is itself a function of sample from a random process, it will exhibit randomness. So, how do we make sound inferences about processes that are random?
